title: More transparency with citizen boards, like JEA, might look a little messy
text: It was interesting to read my colleague Nate Monroe’s article about JEA Board Chairman Helen Albee, who gave fellow board members a sneak peak of her favorable evaluation of the chief executive by emailing them prepared remarks in advance. Nate’s article described a highly scripted board meeting, a board chairman leaning on JEA staff to help with talking points, and emails sent ahead of time to make sure people understand how the meeting is expected to flow. That sharing of Albee’s glowing review of CEO Paul McElroy possibly violated Sunshine Laws, open government advocates said. read more ...
